com.irurueta.server.commons.email

Class MailConfigurationImpl

  • java.lang.Object
    • com.irurueta.server.commons.email.MailConfigurationImpl
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    com.irurueta.server.commons.configuration.Configuration, MailConfiguration

    public class MailConfigurationImpl
extends Object
implements MailConfiguration
    Class containing configuration to send emails, such as email provider, email server (host, port and credentials) and email address to send emails from.

    • Field Summary

      Fields 
      Modifier and Type Field and Description
      private String mailId
      User id to log into SMTP server to send emails.
      private String mAwsMailAccessKey
      Amazon AWS access key to use if Amazon SES is used as a provider.
      private long mAwsMailCheckQuotaAfterMillis
      Milliseconds to wait before checking sending quota to avoid Amazon SES throttling.
      private String mAwsMailSecretKey
      Amazon AWS secret key to use if Amazon SES is used as a provider.
      private String mMailFromAddress
      Email address to send emails from.
      private String mMailHost
      SMTP server host to connect to send emails.
      private String mMailPassword
      User password to log into SMTP server to send emails.
      private int mMailPort
      SMTP server port to connect to send emails.
      private boolean mMailSendingEnabled
      Indicates if email sending is enabled or not.
      private EmailProvider mProvider
      Email provider to use to send emails.

      • mMailHost

        private String mMailHost
        SMTP server host to connect to send emails.

      • mMailPort

        private int mMailPort
        SMTP server port to connect to send emails.

      • mailId

        private String mailId
        User id to log into SMTP server to send emails. This value is optional and can be left as null if server does not require credentials.

      • mMailPassword

        private String mMailPassword
        User password to log into SMTP server to send emails. This value is optional and can be left as null if server does not require credentials.

      • mMailFromAddress

        Email address to send emails from.
